Evidence_Assessment: Lack of corroboration, inconsistencies in testimony
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish credible basis for fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies in narrative, lack of supporting evidence
Legal_Rule: Credibility findings are reviewed under reasonableness standard unless capricious or unsupported
Procedural_Issue: Alleged error in RPD's credibility determination
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of credibility
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD decision found procedurally fair despite minor errors
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's testimony, lack of documentary corroboration
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee protection system, IRPA, Federal Court Rules
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on credibility review
Remedy_Requested: Overturn RPD decision, grant refugee protection
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under section 72 of IRPA
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of IRPA (refugee definition), Section 72 (judicial review)
Applicable_Process: Refugee hearing, followed by Federal Court judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: No error found in RPD decision
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness standard in administrative law review
